text: Kristian Langlo (3 May 1894 - 20 October 1976) was a Norwegian politician for the Liberal Party. He was born in Stranda. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from the Market towns of Møre og Romsdal in 1950, and was later re- elected on one occasion (in 1961). Langlo held various positions in Ålesund city council from 1931 to 1934 and 1945 to 1955, serving as mayor in the period 1947-1949\. ==References== * Category:1894 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Liberal Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Kristian Langlo
